item.description: Working R’s most flexible data type: lists.

item.title: Homework 8: More Data Wrangling
item.description: Homework 8 is nominally due Wednesday, October 14. I’m posting this a bit late, it is somewhat of a bigger homework, and I expect that a lot of people will be late on it. That’s fine.

item.title: Subsetting vectors
item.description: Sometimes it is really helpful to use base R syntax to access parts of vectors and data frames.

item.title: Working with factors: Cut that toxicity out of your life
item.description: Working with factors, which can be dangerous and generally to be avoided.

item.title: dplyr part 4: combining operations with pipes
item.description: Learning how to combine operations with the %>% operator.

item.title: dplyr part 3: splitting data frames with group_by()
item.description: Learning how to do the split part of split-apply-combine.

item.title: dplyr part 2: Performing calculations on data frames
item.description: Calculating values from data frames: summarise() and mutate().

item.title: dplyr part 1: Choosing rows and columns
item.description: Expands on the idea of split-apply-combine and how to use the dplyr package.

item.title: Homework 5
item.description: Homework to practice data transformation, exploration, and plotting.

item.title: Intro to RMarkdown
item.description: Intro to the RMarkdown + knitr system for creating reproducible documents.ß

item.title: The importance of tidy data
item.description: Introduces the idea of tidy data.

item.title: Data frames: Your new favorite data structure
item.description: Discusses the data structure called data frames: what they are and why they are so important.

item.title: Week 3 Resources
item.description: The RStudio list of cheat sheets. The Data Import, Data Transformation, Data Visualization, and RStudio IDE cheat sheets will be particularly valuable to you. R for Data Science Chapter 3 Hadley Wickham on Tidy data. Note that this old-ish paper uses the syntax of a package called plyr, which is a bit different from the tidyverse counterpart called dplyr.

item.title: Homework 4
item.description: This homework, as well as homework 2, is due Wednesday Sept 16.

item.title: Class Style Guide
item.description: Explains why it is so important to format your code well, and how you are expected to format your code for this class.

item.title: Getting help in R
item.description: Introduces how to read documentation for R functions and packages, and how to get help from the internet.

item.title: Intro to packages
item.description: Explains what an R package is, how to install and load them, and discusses a particularly important set of packages called the tidyverse.

item.title: Week 2 resources
item.description: Resources for week 2.

item.description: This homework, as well as homework 3, is due Wednesday Sept 16. Lecture notes coming ASAP.
